result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Isaiah Mathis

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Joseph Isaiah Mathis.  Attorney Kelly O'Neill appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.
Court informed the parties of the information he received regarding mental health program options at the Behavioral Health Division. 
Court ordered case adjourned to allow defense counsel to discuss available options AT BHD with defendant.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Joseph Isaiah Mathis.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly O'Neill in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for hearing.
Case was scheduled for a Hearing in Court with 22CM2751 which had an initial appearance held. This case to follow.
Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond Review Hearing in Branch 30.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Joseph Isaiah Mathis. Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis not in court, in custody. Attorney Kelly O'Neill in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and awaiting global offer. State is going to issue a new case. Court will hear the initial appearance for the new case. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact order Continue with Melissa K., Jenniefer Z., Veronica D., West Allis Dental, Model Empire, Gamestop, Bluemound Ave. to the North, Becher St. to the South, S. 76th St. to the west and South 60th Street to the east. No contact/No Weapons Order.
CASH BOND CONTINUED . Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Joseph Isaiah Mathis.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/01/2022
  Return on warrant scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call.  DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel advises the court he has been unsuccessful in contacting client.  State moves to lift the stay on the bench warrant. 
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner and no action on bail.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant unable to appear for reasons set forth in the record. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.  Calendar call scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 6-24-22, Received and Filed.
JusticePoint Status Report, filed.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense has discovery but needs an offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Isaiah Mathis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Bail/Bond Hearing held.  Arguments heard as to bail.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's bail motion.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Melissa K., Jenniefer Z., Veronica D., West Allis Dental, Model Empire, Gamestop, Bluemound Ave. to the North, Becher St. to the South, S. 76th St. to the West  and South 60th Street to the East.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Joseph Isaiah Mathis in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
